Visit 1: Process Essay

ENG 106L Lesson 7 PDF

In this speaking partner visit, you will read an example of a process essay, discuss the topic of the essay, and practice describing the steps of a process.

Reading and Discussion

First, go through the following vocabulary with your speaking partner to discuss any that is new for you or that you are not sure how it is used in the US, such as a "teaspoon."

Cooking Vocabulary from the Reading

cookie dough brown sugar
molasses baking soda
sodium bicarbonate flour
chocalate chips tablespoon
teaspoon measuring cup
vanilla extract grocery store
stick of butter wet and dry ingredients
baking/cooking sheet grease
parchment paper silicone baking mat
lump of dough inch
puffy

After you have discussed the vocabulary, read about the process for making Chocolate Chip Cookies with your speaking partner. Take turns reading paragraphs. Discuss anything that is new or that you did not understand. Your speaking partner will help you with new or difficult vocabulary, phrases, or pronunciation.

Discuss any of the following topics or questions:

  1. Discuss any questions you have about chocolate chip cookies or other traditional foods in the United States.
  2. Talk about your favorite foods to cook, to eat, or both.
  3. How are ingredient measurements different in your country?
  4. If you noticed any other steps in the cooking process that are different from what you would do, explain how they are different.

Speaking

Part 1: Choose a topic from the topic list for your speaking partner to explain to you, or if you want to learn the process of something in the United States, ask your speaking partner to explain how it is done. After he or she tells you how to do something, ask him or her to explain any steps in the process you did not understand clearly. Understand clearly how to do the process your speaking partner described before you finish discussing it. Ask any questions you have about cultural differences related to the process he or she described.

Part 2: Your speaking partner will choose a topic from the list for you to explain the process for doing something. Provide any background information necessary for him or her to understand what you are describing, and then describe the process clearly. Finally, provide any necessary tips or warnings to make sure he or she understands the result of the process. After you describe the process, your speaking partner will ask you to clarify anything that he or she did not understand.

 

Visit 2: Process Essay

Listening and Speaking

For a warm-up activity, you will listen to a video that describes a process and then describe that same process to your speaking partner. Have a piece of paper and a pen to take notes with while listening. Complete the following steps:

  1. Be prepared to write down the basic steps that the person describes in the video to discuss them with your partner.
  2. Listen to and watch the video that describes how to open a combination lock.
  3. After you listen, read through your notes to make sure you wrote down all of the most important steps that you heard.
  4. Read your notes to your speaking partner, who will check to make sure you understood the process correctly.
  5. If you need to, listen to the video one more time to make sure you understand.
  6. Then, use your notes to describe to your speaking partner how to do the same process.
  7. After you describe the process, your speaking partner will tell you if you missed any steps or how you can describe the process more clearly.

Writing

During this part of the session, you will do a timed writing assignment. You will write at least three paragraphs. It will be related to the content in the unit. Your speaking partner will give you the topic from the topic list. You will plan and write a short essay.

  1. Open a new, blank document in Microsoft Word.
  2. Plan your writing (2-4 minutes).
  3. Write your short essay (10-12 minutes).
  4. Edit your writing (2-4 minutes).
  5. Save your writing.
  6. Copy and paste your writing into the instant message area on Skype. Your Speaking Partner will read it and give you feedback during your tutor session. Think of at least one question you can ask your Speaking Partner about something that will help you improve what you wrote.
  7. If you wish, revise your writing. Use the feedback your Speaking Partner discussed with you. Save your writing again.
  8. After your session, answer the questions above. Then copy and paste your writing into the box as well. Your instructor will read through it and may also give you some feedback.

Process Paper Discussion

Prepare for your speaking partner appointment this week by deciding what you will write about for your process essay. Use the worksheet to help you prepare to write about how to do a process and to talk to your speaking partner about this process. You will not submit the worksheet, but will use it to prepare for your speaking partner appointment. On the worksheet, you will:

  • write what process you will describe
  • make notes on background information that will help you describe this process to your speaking partner
  • make a list of the materials or ingredients you need to complete the process
  • make a list of the steps in the process
  • make notes on how the project should turn out when you are finished

After you complete the worksheet, read through the questions. Your speaking partner will ask you some of these questions.

You can use these questions to prepare.

  1. Why is it important to be able to describe how to complete a process?
  2. Do you think it is easy to describe a process? Why or why not?
  3. It is common for us to describe how to do something to others. What are some processes that you describe often?
  4. What are you going to describe in your process paper?
  5. Tell your speaking partner why this process is important or why you decided to write about it.
  6. What are some details about this process that are necessary for the reader to understand how to do it?
  7. Describe what the project should look like or what should happen at the end of the process.
